item.title: Printable Monster Mouths! Lollipop Template for Halloween Crafts
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: Our Monster Mouths Lollipop template is the perfect Halloween craft activity for a bit of quiet time before the spookiest night of the year.

item.title: Oral Health Risks of Vaping
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: The use of an e-cigarette is often called “vaping,” but “vaping” can also refer to a marijuana vaporizer pen. Learn more about what it is and how it damages both our oral and overall health.

item.title: Quick Tips for Combating the Evils of Halloween Treats
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: It can be difficult to manage the amount of candy that your child gets while out trick or treating. But you can manage the amount of candy that your child keeps. Click to find out solutions other than eating it yourself.

item.title: Is Your Child Smoking?
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: Tobacco contributes to over 7 million deaths worldwide and 6.3 million of those deaths are from smoking cigarettes. See how to confront your teen about smoking cigarettes.

item.title: The Dental Care Approach Is Not the same as Health Care: Preventive vs Restorative Approaches
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: Preventive dental care is as important as preventive health care, but we don’t hear about it nearly as often.

item.title: Removing Teeth Stains and Repairing Stained Enamel with Toothpaste
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: Before removing those stains from your enamel, take a moment to learn about how they got here. Plus, watch how an ADA-certified toothpaste can brush away these wild stains.

item.title: Small Group How To: How Set Up a Basic Employee Wellness Program Part 1 (B2B)
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: Are you interested in motivated and productive employees, a healthier bottom line for your business, and even a better place to work? With a little work, you can do all this by starting a wellness program. Learn how today.

item.title: The Ultimate Ninja Experience: McKenna Haase's Run on American Ninja Warrior
item.dc:creator: McKenna Haase, guest blogger and our first Authentically Iowan
item.description: Our first Authentically Iowan, McKenna Haase, recently competed on American Ninja Warrior. Read all about her journey and the lessons she learned in her blog post!

item.title: What’s Staining Our Tooth Enamel? | The Tooth Enamel Egg-speriment [VIDEO]
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: Watch how we use eggshells to demonstrate which beverages have the most tooth enamel-staining power.

item.title: Small Group How To: How Make Employee Wellness Programs Stick Part 2 (B2B)
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: A successful employee wellness program means that team members are engaged, and new staff are encouraged to participate. See what else makes employer-sponsored wellness initiatives work.

item.title: People with Dental Benefits are Healthier
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: If you have dental benefits and a dentist that is convenient to get to, you are more likely to get the care you and your family needs for a healthy smile. Learn more.

item.title: Pregnancy, Dental Care, and Your Vision | Changes to Anticipate During Pregnancy
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: Learn about how your oral health and vision can be impacted during pregnancy.

item.title: Dental Health Literacy Pamphlet for Employees | Basic Dental Coverage Terms (B2B)
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: Ensure your employees understand their insurance policies and know how to make the most of them with this handy infographic. Print this out and pin around the office!

item.title: Screen Overload: Five Tips to Avoid Eye Strain
item.description: According to Nielson research, the average U.S. adult is spending nearly 11 hours interacting with screens. It’s no wonder that 70 to 90 percent of heavy computer or screen users experience symptoms of computer vision syndrome. What tips can you implement into your technology-filled routine to avoid eye strain?

item.title: Adulting: Making smart health benefits decisions all on your own
item.description: Adulting is the process of making decisions, minor and major, for the first time on your own. Some decisions are easy - like what to buy at the grocery store or organizing a ski trip with friends. And some are not so easy – like deciding how much rent you can afford, taking precious vacation days from your new job for your Wi-Fi to be installed, and for newly hired graduates - choosing health benefits for the first time.

item.title: Disposable Contact Lens Are Not So Disposable
item.description: Americans flush nearly 2.9 billion contact lenses down the drain each year, according to a 2018 research study from Arizona State University. More and more research indicates that micro-plastics are becoming a macro-problem – polluting our rivers, streams, and oceans and ending up in our soil.

item.title: Vaping and Dental Surgery
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: E-cigarettes and vapes make it more difficult for us to heal after dental surgery. Click to learn why.

item.title: Lemon Water and Dental Health
item.dc:creator: Jill Hamilton
item.description: Lemon juice is proven to damage tooth enamel and compromise our oral health. Learn if you should stop drinking lemon water.

item.title: Healthy Outdoor Smiles | How to Have Good Oral Health While Camping [INFOGRAPHIC]
item.description: Use our tips for keeping a healthy mouth while camping.

item.title: Restoration vs Dentures – How Will My Dentures Look?
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: Dentures are an alternative many older adults turn to when tooth loss becomes a reality. Get all the details on how dentures can impact your appearance at the beginning of the process and as a long-time denture wearer.

item.title: Reset and Rethink Your Drink!
item.description: Water is magical with it long list of benefits like jumpstarting your metabolism in the morning, helping to keep your skin moisturized, and supporting healthy digestion, circulation and kidney function. It's always important to drink water, but especially during the summer, so the start of summer is a great time to refocus your H2O efforts.

item.title: Facts About Dental X-rays [Infographic]
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: Whether it’s a broken bone or damage to teeth and gums, dental x-rays allow things to be seen that could go unnoticed during a routine visual exam. Get to know how dental x-rays work and how they work for us.

item.title: The Kombucha Health Drink Craze | Is It Actually Good for You?
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: Learn what’s in kombucha that can harm your teeth and what to do to prevent the kombucha health drink from causing enamel erosion.

item.title: Every Racecar Driver and Ninja Has to Start Somewhere
item.description: Delta Dental of Iowa celebrates Iowans who are making things happen … chasing their dreams … doing things differently … all while staying true to their values and working toward a bigger purpose than personal success. They are Authentically Iowans. Our first Authentically Iowan is Carlisle native, McKenna Haase. At 22, McKenna is already a champion Sprint racecar driver, the first and only female to win a feature race at the nationally famous Knoxville Speedway.

item.title: Authentically Iowan - McKenna Haase
item.description: Delta Dental of Iowa is celebrating Iowans who make extraordinary things happen — the folks chasing their dreams … shaking things up … all while staying true to their values and working toward a bigger purpose than their own personal success. They are Authentically Iowan. Our first Authentically Iowan is Carlisle native and race car driver, McKenna Haase.

item.title: Crowded or Crooked Teeth in Older Adults
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: We’re straightening out the misconception that braces are just for kids. Click to learn what experts recommend for crowded or crooked teeth in older adulthood.

item.title: Dental Care Product Trends – Should You Buy the Latest gadgets?
item.description: A 4-minute read on the four latest dental care tools – are they necessary?

item.title: You Control Your Age | Living a Healthy and Active Lifestyle
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: If you’re living a healthy and active lifestyle, it’s likely you feel much younger than your actual age. If that doesn’t sound like you, it’s possible you’re not in control of your age. Learn more about how oral and overall health helps you control your age.

item.title: Employer Benefits Study | 2018 Findings on Employers Offering Dental Insurance
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: More employers are offering dental insurance for a competitive advantage and the trend shows no sign of slowing down.

item.title: Electric Toothbrush Fails
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: It never fails, you’re on your way to work or school and you have a dried white spot on that freshly pressed shirt from toothpaste splattering. Are you not using your electric toothbrush correctly? Read our tips to avoid these electric toothbrush fails.

item.title: Medications + Your Mouth | Causes of Dry Mouth in Older Adults
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: Dry mouth IS NOT something that comes with age. The side effects of medication often cause dry mouth, and we have tips to alleviate it.

item.title: Restorative Care vs Dentures | Impact of Dentures on Health
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: Tooth loss used to be inevitable. Today, advances in technology and dental care allow us to keep our teeth longer than our ancestors ever did. But, longer-lasting, natural teeth means more risk for tooth decay. Dental caries or cavities is the leading cause of tooth loss in the United States today. If you or someone you love is missing teeth, consider the impact of dentures and restorative care on older adults. Make a fully-educated decision on your oral health or the oral health of a loved one.

item.title: Dentists, Diabetes, and You: Effects Diabetes has on Teeth and Gums
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: Dental patients with diabetes benefit from dental cleanings as they help reduce the patient’s risk for unhealthy glucose levels.

item.title: How to Encourage Your Employees to Visit the Dentist
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: Encourage employee dental benefits and hygiene practices for more workers at work and not in the dental chair.

item.title: What's in My Disposable Water Bottles?
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: When comparing the effects of plastic disposable water bottles to tap water, studies indicate that storage may be the biggest influencer in safety terms.

item.title: Kids Continue to Miss School Because of Dental Problems
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: The dental health of children is critical for their overall health and well-being. Every year kids miss valuable school days due to dental problems.

item.title: Fluoride Facts for Informed Iowans
item.description: In 2018, the Delta Dental of Iowa Foundation awarded more than $2.3 million to Iowa non-profits to improve the oral and overall health of Iowans. Two of the projects highlighted in our blog post and video “10 Years of Bringing Smiles and Improving the Health of Iowans” included community water fluoridation projects and Rethink Your Drink.

item.title: Creative Activities for Children’s Dental Health Month Festivities
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: National Children’s Dental Health Month is dedicated to making untreated tooth decay -the most common chromic disease in children – history with dental health activities for kids.

item.title: She Has Your Cavities: Why Parents Have Kids with Cavities
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: Kids with cavities and a fear of the dentist often share these traits with their parents or guardians.

item.title: American Heart Month: Valentine’s Day
item.dc:creator: Shakara Robinson
item.description: Ongoing studies prove a connection between gum disease and heart health. Keep your smile and heart healthy with these tips.

item.title: 2019: The Year You Use Your Benefits Wisely
item.description: Each year we set new year's resolutions to improve our health. But working with your insurance benefits is often forgotten. Follow these ideas to learn about your benefits and make sure you're getting the most out of them in 2019.

item.title: Which Generation has the Best Oral Health?
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: Which generations have good oral health habits? We dive into why the answer isn’t as simple as you think.

item.title: Dental Visits Decoded: Are Cleanings Necessary?
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: Regular teeth cleanings are a necessary part of staying healthy and strong.

item.title: Top 5 Tooth Brushing App for Kids | Improve Your Child’s Smile
item.dc:creator: Shakara Robinson
item.description: Having trouble getting your child to brush their teeth? Try a tooth brushing app for kids:

item.title: Dental Office Smells a Turn Off? Aromatherapy Can Help
item.dc:creator: Shakara Robinson
item.description: That weird dental office smell doesn’t have to keep patients away anymore, thanks to aromatherapy. This is how it works:

item.title: What’s the Cost of Avoiding the Dentist?
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: Are you avoiding the dentist due to the cost? See what the real cost of skipping the dentist is when it impacts your overall health…

item.title: Open Enrollment is a Time to Take Stock of Your Overall Health
item.dc:creator: Jill Hamilton
item.description: We’ve survived Thanksgiving and Black Friday, and our thoughts quickly turn to the next big event. No, not the holidays, but open enrollment for insurance.

item.title: Bedside Manner for Dentists, Receptions, Hygienists, and the Dental Office
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: Adding a dentist interview to your to-do list, combined with building trust, will make a world of difference if you have anxiety about the dentist.

item.title: 9 Common Questions and Answers for Parents Considering Braces for their Children
item.dc:creator: Shelby Tatomir
item.description: If you’re a parent considering braces for your child, read these answers to frequently asked questions about braces.

item.title: The Dangers of Do-It-Yourself Dental Work
item.dc:creator: Shakara Robinson
item.description: DIY dental care can be disastrous. It can lead to a more painful smile than you started with!
